etymologies: early 18th century: from French, from Latin solitarius (see solitary)

definitions: any of various card games played by one person, the object of which is to use up all one's cards by forming particular arrangements and sequences.
a diamond or other gem set in a piece of jewelry by itself
shortDefinitions: gem set in piece of jewellery by itself

definitions: a ring set with a solitaire diamond or other gem.
either of two large extinct flightless birds related to the dodo, found on two of the Mascarene Islands until they were exterminated in the 18th century.

notes.text: Family Raphidae: the Rodriguez solitaire (Pezophaps solitaria), and the poorly known Réunion solitaire (Ornithaptera solitaria)

shortDefinitions: either of two large extinct flightless birds related to dodo

definitions: a large American thrush with mainly gray plumage and a short bill.

notes.text: Genus Myadestes, subfamily Turdinae, family Muscicapidae: several species

shortDefinitions: large American thrush with mainly grey plumage
